revised_title: Managing Zander Invasions and Fish Stocks in Water Systems
tldr: The article discusses the invasion of zander, an invasive fish species, in water systems managed by the Severn-Trent Water Authority. The authors describe the distribution, population growth, and impact on recipient fisheries. They recommend monitoring and control of zander populations, particularly in open-ended watercourses, to maintain a diverse range of species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Environmental Science
